text.#text:
The purpose of the Healthy Food Financing
			 Initiative is to improve access to healthy foods in underserved areas, to
			 create and preserve quality jobs, and to revitalize low-income communities by
			 providing loans and grants to retailers of fresh and healthy food to overcome
			 the higher costs and initial barriers to entry in underserved urban, suburban,
			 and rural areas.

The national fund manager shall award national funds to
			 partnerships through a competitive process on an annual basis.

			 implement fresh food financing programs in underserved areas quickly.

			 diversity.

the degree of

			 State or local economic development programs;

the degree of
			 community engagement and support in the development and retention of
			 supermarkets and other healthy food retailers; and

the contribution
			 of the program of the partnership to the overall geographic diversity of the
			 Initiative.
